result.execSummary:
The defendant Kadi A Devine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence and places Ms. Devine on Probation for two years.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge

--to reimburse drug buy money of $220

--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription

--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as approved by the Agent

--to undergo any other type assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent

--to be subject random drug testing 

--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed

--to comply with DNA sample upon request

-- If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY: Jefferson County Sheriff
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations

timeConds.notes:
--to serve 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges for employment and treatment, to commence on 1/2/17 at  6:00pm

--the Court authorizes transfer of the service of this Jail term to the Waukesha County Jail conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring for service of the jail term

--Ms. Devine is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in her system;  non-compliance will result in loss of Work-Release privileges without further process.

*** 5/1/17 The Court authorizes Huber effective June 1, 2017 Huber is reinstated for employment and treatment, subject to absolute sobriety.***

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
[MA]Case called at 3:52pm 
Defendant Kadi A Devine in court, in custody.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

On Defendant's Request for Reinstatement of Huber:
--The Court reviews submissions by Defendant
--Argument given by ADA Hall in opposition of Huber 
--ADA Hall clarifies that would not object to Huber for CSW work, and possibly for treatment only.
--The Court questions Ms. Devine as to treatment and employment

The Court authorizes Huber effective June 1, 2017 Huber is reinstated for employment and treatment, subject to absolute sobriety.
The Court directs that an amended JOC to prepared to that effect. 

recess: 4:06pm
Set for Hearing
Hearing on May 1, 2017 at 03:15 pm.
from the State in response to the Defendant's letter requesting huber be reinstated
from Defendant requesting reinstatement of Huber
Denied. Violation of absolute sobriety rule creates high risk of re-offending cc: ALL
requesting reinstatement of Huber
Huber is approved ONLY for CSW work in the jail subject to the discretion of the sheriff
Unless you can prove that you had a valid prescription for the drug that you ingested, this request is denied as I promised at sentencing.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 10:15am. 
Defendant Kadi A Devine in court with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  ADA Jeffrey M Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing arguments are given by counsel. 
Ms. Devine makes a statement. 

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence and places Ms. Devine on Probation for two years, with conditions:  
--to serve 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges for employment and treatment, to commence on 1/2/17 at 6:00pm
--the Court authorizes transfer of the service of this Jail term to the Waukesha County Jail conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring for service of the jail term
--Ms. Devine is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in her system;  non-compliance will result in loss of Work-Release privileges without further process.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other type assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--to be subject random drug testing 
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as approved by the Agent 
--to reimburse drug buy money of $220 
--to comply with DNA sample upon request
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge


The Court gives 2 days credit for time already served.

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
recess 10:40am.
Sentencing hearing on December 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Criminal Case Settlement Agreement form.

Case called at 11:09am [ma]
Defendant Kadi A Devine in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

Atty. De La Rosa requests to have Sentencing scheduled for a later date
--no objection from State as long as within 30 days

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
Bond remains as fixed.
recess: 11:20am

NEXT: Sentencing on 12/6/16 at 10:00am
Scheduling Order
Jury trial on November 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on November 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.
